titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James M. Alvey, Judgment
CWG10496

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Grayson Circuit Court Sct
May 14 May Term 1861
Commonwealth Plff
against } Indictment for Keeping a Tipling House
James M Alvey Deft

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth and the Deft filed a Plea of Not Guilty and thereupon came a Jury Jno Craig Wm Proctor Andrew Burtte, James Summers, W. C. Simpson, Michael Patterson, Josiah Stone, Jack Shively, Saml Young Jno A Skees, A. D. Skaggs, Jacob Miller, who were sworn to try the issue Joined, who Returned the following verdict, "We the Jury find the Defendant, guilty as charged in the within Indictment"
It is therefore adjudged by the Court that the Commonwealth Recover against the Defendant the sum of Sixty dollars for said offence, also her costs herein Expended & may have Execution

A Copy
Attest Edwin Thomas clk
Grayson Circuit court

No 89 Com
Commonwealth
vs } Copy Judgment
James M. Alvey
